page.title: 02LANDSCAPE & BUILDINGS
page.content: There are several listed buildings of interest in the area.{ASHLEY COTTAGE; late 17th cent or early 18th cent,two story,red & grey brickwork,old tile roof.{GROVE FARMHOUSE;}18th cent.barns 15th cent.surounded by partly preserv- ed square moat.{THE OLD OAK FARMHOUSE; with two barns,early 17th cent.with additions.{FLAMSTED FARM;}16th to 17th cent.barns & outhouses.{HOG LANE FARM; old,attractive,good barns.{ASHLEY {GREEN VILLAGE CHURCH;}erected 1873.{ {ASHLYNS HALL;}18th cent.large company headquarters set in 20 acres of park & woodland.Other landscape features are the pond at the east side of ASHLEY GREEN village green,also the large ch- stnut tree and pudding stone on the green.Grove Lane,Whelpley Hill, is a lane with a wide verge.
